entry.title: The Northern Ireland Assembly (Elections and Periodsof Suspension) Act 2003 (Consequential Modifications) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order modifies the Representation of the People Act 1983 (“the 1983 Act”) in connection with provision made under the amendment made by section 1(2) of the Northern Ireland Assembly (Elections and Periods of Suspension) Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”). The provision in question is the Order made by the Secretary of State specifying the date for the next Assembly election as 26th November 2003. The Order also modifies section 1 of the Allowances to Members of the Assembly Act (Northern Ireland) 2000 in connection with provision made under the amendment made by section 4 of the 2003 Act. The provision in question is a determination made by the Secretary of State under sections 47 and 48 of the Northern Ireland Act 1998 by virtue of section 4 of the 2003 Act.

entry.title: The Income Support (General) (Standard Interest Rate Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Schedule 3 to the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, as substituted and amended, with respect to the standard rate of interest applicable to a loan which qualifies for income support under that Schedule to those Regulations. The rate is decreased from 5.34 per cent. to 5.07 per cent. (regulation 2). The Regulations also revoke, with a saving provision, the Income Support (General) (Standard Interest Rate Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002 which made a previous amendment to the standard rate of interest (regulation 3).

entry.title: The Road Traffic (Permitted Parking Area and Special Parking Area) (Metropolitan Borough of Wirral) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order applies to whole of the metropolitan borough of Wirral except the roads specified in Article 3.

entry.title: Plant Health (Amendment No. 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health Order (Northern Ireland) 1993 so as to implement:Commission Directives 2002/36/EC (O.J. No. L116, 3.5.02, p. 16), and 2003/22/EC (O.J. No. L78, 25.3.03, p. 10) which amend various Annexes to Council Directive 2000/29/EC (O.J. No. L169, 10.7.00, p. 1) on protective measures against the introduction into the Community of organisms harmful to plants or plant products and against their spread within the Community; andCommission Directive 2003/21/EC (O.J. No. L78, 25.3.03, p. 8) which amends some protective zones exposed to particular plant health risks in the Community in Commission Directive 2001/32/EC (O.J. No. L127, 9.5.01, p. 38).

entry.title: The Income Tax (Pay As You Earn) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: Following the rewrite of the primary legislation relating to pay as you earn in Part 11 of the Income Tax (Earnings and Pensions) Act 2003, these Regulations rewrite, with minor changes, the Income Tax (Employments) Regulations 1993 and regulation 13 of the Income Tax (Employments) (Notional Payments) Regulations 1994.

entry.title: Education (Revocation of Spent Provisions) (England) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the Education (Revocation of Spent Provisions) (England) Regulations 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Contracting Out (Local Education Authority Functions) (England) (Amendment) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Contracting Out (Local Education Authority Functions) (England) Order 2002. That order “the 2002 Order” enabled local education authorities to authorise other persons to exercise certain specified statutory functions of the authority on its behalf. The statutory functions which the authority could delegate in this way are specified in the Schedules to the 2002 Order. This Order amends the 2002 Order so that it now covers three new statutory functions of local education authorities which were created or amended by the Education Act 2002.

entry.title: The Road Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment) (No. 4) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Construction and Use Regulations 1986 by inserting a new regulation 110.

entry.title: The Income Support (General) (Standard Interest Rate Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Schedule 3 to the Income Support (General) Regulations 1987 (S.I. 1987/1967), as substituted and amended, with respect to the standard rate of interest applicable to a loan which qualifies for income support under that Schedule to those Regulations. The new rate is 5.07 per cent. (regulation 2). The Regulations also revoke, with a saving provision, regulations which made the previous amendment to that standard rate of interest (regulation 3).

entry.title: Management of Health and Safety at Work and Fire Precautions (Workplace) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2000 (“the 2000 Regulations”) and the Fire Precautions (Workplace) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (“the 2001 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Burma (Sale, Supply and Export of Goods) (Penalties) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Burma (Sale, Supply and Export of Goods) (Penalties) (Amendment) Regulations 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Offshore Installations (Safety Zones) (No. 3) Order 2003
entry.summary: This order establishes, under section 22 of the Petroleum Act 1987, safety zones having a radius of 500 metres from the specified point around each installation specified in the Schedule to this order and stationed in waters to which section 21(7) of that Act applies (these include territorial waters and waters in areas designated under section 1(7) of the Continental Shelf Act 1964 (c. 29)) (article 2).

entry.title: The Building (Amendment) Regulations 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These regulations amend the Building Regulations 2000 (S.I. 2000/2531 amended by S.I. 2001/3335, 2002/440 and 2002/2871), “the principal Regulations”.

entry.title: The Co-operatives and Community Benefit Societies Act 2003 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings sections 4 to 6 of the Co-operatives and Community Benefit Societies Act 2003 into force on 20th October 2003, and sections 2 and 3 of that Act into force on 1st April 2004. Section 4 of that Act (purported contracts, deeds and obligations) will only apply to contracts and deeds made, and obligations undertaken, on or after 20th October 2003.

entry.title: The Smoke Control Areas (Authorised Fuels) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, revoke and re-enact with amendments the Smoke Control Areas (Authorised Fuels) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 which previously prescribed authorised fuels for the purposes of the Clean Air (Northern Ireland) Order 1981.

entry.title: The A47 Trunk Road (Thorney Bypass) (Detrunking) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A47 Trunk Road (Thorney Bypass) (Detrunking) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Public Service Vehicles (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Public Service Vehicles Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1985 as follows.

entry.title: The A47 Trunk Road (Thorney Bypass) Order 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The A47 Trunk Road (Thorney Bypass) Order 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The National Health Service Superannuation Scheme (Scotland) Amendment (No. 3) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service Superannuation Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 1995 (“the 1995 Regulations”) which provide for the superannuation of persons engaged in the National Health Service in Scotland. Certain provisions have retrospective effect as authorised by section 12 of the Superannuation Act 1972: Regulation 6 shall have effect from 6th April 2003 and regulations 7 and 8 shall have effect from 1st April 2003. All other amendments shall have effect from the date of coming into force of the Regulations.

title.div: The Local Authorities (Allowances for Members of County and County Borough Councils) (Past Service Awards) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Lwfansau i Aelodau Cynghorau Sir a Chynghorau Bwrdeistref Sirol) (Dyfarndaliadau am Wasanaeth a Roddwyd) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: Section 18(3A) of the Local Government and Housing Act 1989, as inserted by section 99(7) of the Local Government Act 2000 (“the 2000 Act”), provides the power for the Secretary of State to make regulations which may make provision for or in connection with enabling county and county borough councils to determine which of their members are entitled to gratuities. Section 18(3A) is exercisable by the National Assembly for Wales by virtue of the National Assembly for Wales (Transfer of Functions) Order 1999. Section 13(3)(a) of the 2000 Act allows the National Assembly for Wales to make provision for any function of a local authority specified in regulations made under that section to be a function which is not to be the responsibility of an executive under executive arrangements. Section 32 of the 2000 Act permits the making of like amendments in respect of councils operating “alternative arrangements” with a Board rather than an executive.

Mae adran 18(3A) o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol a Thai 1989, fel y'i mewnosodwyd gan adran 99(7) o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000 (“Deddf 2000”), yn darparu'r pŵer i'r Ysgrifennydd Gwladol wneud rheoliadau. Caiff y rheoliadau hynny wneud darpariaeth ar gyfer neu mewn cysylltiad â galluogi cynghorau sir a chynghorau bwrdeistref sirol i benderfynu pa rai o'u haelodau sydd â hawl i arian rhodd. Mae adran 18(3A) yn arferadwy gan Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru yn rhinwedd Gorchymyn Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru (Trosglwyddo Swyddogaethau) 1999. Mae adran 13(3)(a) o Ddeddf 2000 yn caniatáu i Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru wneud darpariaeth bod unrhyw un o swyddogaethau awdurdod lleol sydd wedi'i phennu mewn rheoliadau a wnaed o dan yr adran honno yn swyddogaeth nad yw gweithrediaeth i fod yn gyfrifol amdani o dan drefniadau gweithrediaeth. Mae adran 32 o Ddeddf 2000 yn caniatáu i ddiwygiadau cyffelyb gael eu gwneud ynglŷn â chynghorau sy'n gweithredu “trefniadau amgen” gyda Bwrdd yn hytrach na gweithrediaeth.
